item.title: 俄罗斯贵金属对华销售额达 10 亿美元
item.description: 由于创纪录的黄金价格提高了收入，今年上半年俄罗斯对中国的贵金属出口几乎翻了一番。【原文：Russian precious metals exports to China almost doubled in the first half of the year, as record gold prices boost revenue.】

item.title: 俄罗斯在印度的炼油厂在受到限制后寻求提前付款
item.description: 在欧盟对一家俄罗斯能源生产商实施制裁后，该公司在印度的一家炼油厂收紧了产品销售条件，这凸显了更严格的限制措施对加工商、其客户和更广泛市场的影响。【原文：A refinery in India that’s part-owned by a Russian energy producer tightened conditions for selling products after the European Union imposed sanctions on the company, highlighting the fallout for the processor, its customers, and the wider market from the tougher restrictions.】

item.title: KKR 将以 27 亿欧元的估值投资 CVC 旗下的 Etraveli 公司
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.将收购 CVC Capital Partners Plc 支持的 Etraveli Group 的大量少数股权，该交易对这家瑞典旅游技术公司的估值约为 27 亿欧元（约合 31 亿美元）。【原文：KKR & Co. is buying a significant minority stake in CVC Capital Partners Plc-backed Etraveli Group in a deal valuing the Swedish travel technology firm at about €2.7 billion ($3.1 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国石油公司任命阿尔伯特-曼尼福德为新任董事长，重新调整战略
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）在激进股东埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）要求改变公司发展方向的压力下，任命艾伯特-曼尼福德（Albert Manifold）为新董事长，接替海尔格-伦德（Helge Lund）。【原文：BP Plc appointed Albert Manifold as its new chairman, replacing Helge Lund amid pressure for a change in the company’s direction from activist shareholder Elliott Investment Management.】

item.title: 德国顶级企业推动投资以帮助恢复增长
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔茨和 60 多家德国领先企业发起了一项新的投资活动，价值至少 1,000 亿欧元（1,160 亿美元），以帮助欧洲最大的经济体摆脱困境。【原文：German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and more than 60 of the nation’s leading companies launched a new investment drive worth at least €100 billion ($116 billion) to help lift Europe’s biggest economy out of its funk.】

item.title: 日本大选历史性失利后，石破茂试图争取时间
item.description: 日本首相石破茂在不到一年的时间里第二次在大选中受挫，这使他在抵制反对派的减税要求或在最后一刻与美国达成贸易协议方面处于较弱的地位，因此他试图为自己的首相任期争取时间。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba sought to buy time for his premiership following a second election setback in less than a year that leaves him in a weaker position to stave off opposition tax cut demands or secure a last-minute trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 莫桑比克即将达成重启 200 亿美元天然气项目的协议
item.description: 莫桑比克总统丹尼尔-查波（Daniel Chapo）表示，他希望很快结束与道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）的谈判，重启一个价值 200 亿美元的天然气项目。【原文：Mozambican President Daniel Chapo said he expects to soon conclude talks with TotalEnergies SE over the restart of a $20 billion natural-gas project that halted four years ago because of an Islamist-militant insurgency.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：贸易紧张局势激化，英国股市震荡下行
印尼普拉博沃推出首批 8 万个 "红白 "合作社以促进经济增长
item.description: 印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）周一启动了计划中的数千个新社区合作社中的首批合作社，寄希望于自上而下的方法和印尼国有银行提供的数十亿美元贷款来促进这个东南亚国家的发展和粮食自给自足。【原文：President Prabowo Subianto on Monday launched the first of thousands of planned new community cooperatives, betting on a top-down approach and billions of dollars in loans from Indonesia’s state banks to spur development and food self-sufficiency in the Southeast Asian nation.】

item.title: 高盛解析中国数据，发现中国工资增长是科维迪克之外最差的
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：China’s wage growth is so anemic it’s slowed to the weakest pace outside the pandemic, an alternative indicator compiled by Goldman Sachs Group Inc. showed, revealing an obstacle to stronger consumption at home as risks abroad mount.】

item.title: 印尼 "袋鼠 "债券销售对当地投资者来说是个棘手的问题
item.description: 印尼计划在下个月首次发行澳元计价债务，这激起了投资者的兴趣，但如何将其纳入当地经理人的投资组合，问题也越来越多。【原文：Indonesia’s plan to issue its first Australian dollar-denominated debt next month has piqued investor interest, though questions mount on how it’ll fit into local managers’ portfolios.】

item.title: 新加坡将在第一期股票计划中拨款 8.56 亿美元
item.description: 新加坡计划向摩根大通资产管理公司（JP Morgan Asset Management）等三家资产管理公司拨款 11 亿新元（约合 8.56 亿美元），作为提高流动性和扩大投资者参与本地股市的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：Singapore plans to allocate S$1.1 billion ($856 million) to three asset managers, including JP Morgan Asset Management, as part of a broader effort to enhance liquidity and expand investor participation in the local stock market.】

item.title: 中国长期债券因巨型水坝可能支撑经济而下跌
item.description: 由于投资者认为西藏 1.2 万亿元（1,670 亿美元）巨型水坝项目的启动将为经济提供更多支持，中国较长期限的政府债券在避险资产需求减弱的情况下下跌。【原文：China’s longer tenor government bonds fell amid waning demand for haven assets as investors saw the launch of a 1.2 trillion yuan ($167 billion) mega-dam project in Tibet providing more support to the economy.】

item.title: 高盛聘请阿波罗房地产公司高管在澳大利亚任职
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份备忘录，高盛集团已聘请阿波罗全球管理公司高管 Samuel Green 担任其澳大利亚房地产投资团队的董事总经理。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has hired Apollo Global Management Inc. executive Samuel Green as managing director for its Australian real estate investing team, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 马来西亚法院暂停针对总理安瓦尔的性侵犯诉讼
item.description: 马来西亚上诉法院批准了总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）的申请，全面暂停一名前助手对他提起的民事诉讼。【原文：A Malaysian Court of Appeal granted Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s application to fully pause a civil lawsuit against him by a former aide who alleged he was sexually assaulted in 2018.】

item.title: 日本刚刚赶上了世界其他国家的步伐
item.description:
愤怒的选民惩罚了长期执政的 政党，而不是特朗普的关税。【原文：

Fed-up voters punished a long-ruling party disrupted by more than Trump’s tariffs. 

】

item.title: 欧洲央行稍事休息，但繁忙的数据周将有助于决定下一步行动
item.description: 准备参加周四欧洲央行利率制定会议的投资者还应关注本周的大量经济报告，以判断货币政策的走向。【原文：Investors preparing for the European Central Bank’s interest rate-setting meeting on Thursday should also focus on a plethora of economic reports this week to gauge where monetary policy is headed.】

item.title: 敦促英国央行暂缓向市场投放长期债券
item.description: 最近的市场动荡凸显了英国长期国债需求的脆弱性，英国央行正面临着持有超过四分之一债券的压力，而且有可能一持有就是几十年。【原文：The Bank of England is facing pressure to hold onto more than a quarter of its bond holdings, potentially for decades, after recent market turmoil highlighted the fragility of demand for long-dated UK government debt.】

item.title: 报告称印度 SEBI 允许简街恢复交易
item.description: 印度《商业标准报》（Business Standard）周一援引未透露身份的人士的话报道称，在简街集团将 484 亿卢比（约合 5.64 亿美元）的所谓 "非法所得 "存入托管账户后，印度证券监管机构已允许该公司恢复在该国股市的交易。【原文：India’s securities regulator has allowed Jane Street Group to resume trading in the country’s stock market after the firm deposited 48.4 billion rupees ($564 million) in alleged “unlawful gains” into an escrow account, the Business Standard reported Monday, citing people it didn’t identify.】

item.title: 印度股票分析师在多空模型方面领先全球同行
item.description: 与其他主要市场相比，卖方分析师似乎已成为印度投资者更有价值的资源。在一些观察家看来，印度 5.4 万亿美元股票市场的结构性特质正在为熟练的选股专家带来优势。【原文：Sell-side analysts appear to have emerged as a more valuable resource for investors in India than in any other major market. To some observers, structural idiosyncrasies in the nation’s $5.4 trillion stock market are giving skilled stock-pickers an edge.】

item.title: 关税期限临近，韩国高官再次访美
item.description: 韩国国家安全顾问在不到两周的时间内第二次访问美国，因为首尔正在加紧努力，以避免美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在8月1日的最后期限之前提出的25%的全面关税。【原文：South Korea’s national security adviser made a second trip to the US in under two weeks, as Seoul intensifies efforts to avert sweeping 25% tariffs proposed by President Donald Trump ahead of an Aug. 1 deadline.】

item.title: 电路板制造商胜利巨头据称考虑在香港上市
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，胜利巨人科技（惠州）有限公司正在考虑在香港上市，可能筹集约 10 亿美元资金。【原文：Victory Giant Technology (Huizhou) Co. is considering a listing in Hong Kong that could raise about $1 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 北京瞄准价格战，美团与送餐员一起跳槽
item.description: 在中国政府试图抑制餐饮行业猖獗的价格竞争之后，美团领涨中国餐饮外卖股。【原文：Meituan led gains in China’s food-delivery shares after the authorities sought to damp down rampant price competition in the sector.】

item.title: 微软服务器软件遭受大范围网络攻击
item.description: 微软公司的服务器软件正遭受不明身份黑客的攻击，网络安全分析师警告说，全球范围内普遍存在安全漏洞。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s server software is under attack from unidentified hackers, with cybersecurity analysts warning of widespread security breaches across the globe.】

item.title: 中国大坝项目提振铁矿石市场前景，铁矿石与钢材一同飙升
item.description: 铁矿石和钢材攀升至四个月高点，因为中国在西藏修建巨型水坝的计划增强了需求前景。【原文：Iron ore and steel climbed to a four-month high, as China’s plan for a mega dam in Tibet bolstered the outlook for demand.】

item.title: 看好人工智能需求，台积电跻身万亿美元俱乐部
item.description: 台湾半导体制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s market value hit $1 trillion for the first time last week, driven by a raised outlook and optimism over robust artificial intelligence demand.】

item.title: 印度议会因有争议的选民修订案引发轩然大波
item.description: 印度反对党正准备在周一议会召开季风会议之际，就东部比哈尔邦有争议的选民名册修订问题与印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）的政府进行交锋。【原文：India’s opposition is preparing to confront Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government over the controversial revision of electoral rolls in the eastern state of Bihar, as the Parliament convenes for its monsoon session on Monday.】

item.title: 比亚迪在中国汽车市场的地位开始动摇
item.description: 事实证明，中国领先汽车制造商的高层生活十分复杂，新的挑战即将到来。【原文：Life at the top is proving complex for China’s leading automaker, and there are fresh challenges on the horizon.】

item.title: 分析师认为日本大选后日元和股市波动将加剧
item.description: 策略师表示，由于日本首相石破茂的执政联盟在上议院选举中受挫，使人们对日本的政策方向产生怀疑，从而削弱了日本资产的吸引力，日元兑美元汇率可能会出现波动。【原文：The yen may be volatile against the dollar as a setback for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s ruling coalition in the upper house election casts doubt over the nation’s policy direction, dimming the appeal of Japanese assets, strategists say.】
